intro: Inobulbon, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant with striking botanical features. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, known for its unusual and ethereal appearance. The plant produces small, white, lantern-like flowers that emit a faint bioluminescent glow at night. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of a fern, adding to its mysterious allure. Inobulbon thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
